definition: to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct

sentences.english: France's Gendarmerie Nationale recently decided to review its IT infrastructure policies.
sentences.chinese: 法國國家憲兵隊最近決定整改它的IT基建設施政策。

sentences.english: Cheung Kong (Holdings) Ltd., controlled by billionaire Li Ka-shing, also took part.
sentences.chinese: 億萬富翁李嘉誠控制的長江基建也參與了其中。

sentences.english: Construction Project Budgeting and Final Accounting Specialty should undergo reforms.
sentences.chinese: 基建工程預決算專業的教學改革應與時俱進。

sentences.english: He also said the city had stopped using land as collateral for infrastructure loans.
sentences.chinese: 他還說，成都市已經停止用土地作爲基建貸款的抵押。

sentences.english: After the war, Clay advocated for improvements to internal infrastructure and to stabilize the national financial system.
sentences.chinese: 戰後，克萊主張大興基建工程和穩定國家經濟體系。

sentences.english: Once a construction project starts upstream, it requires water compensation downstream.
sentences.chinese: 一旦上游開始基建項目，下游就需要對用水進行補償。

sentences.english: Be strict with construction management and prohibit those construction projects that exceed their budgets.
sentences.chinese: 嚴格進行基建管理，杜絕超預算工程的發生。

sentences.english: And as they are large scale infra-structural projects, they cannot be speeded up at will.
sentences.chinese: 和他們大規模的基建項目，他們不能加快在意願。

sentences.english: He also undertook to earmark $235 billion in government expenditure on infrastructure projects within five years.
sentences.chinese: 承諾在五年內投資二千三百五十億元進行基建。

definition: public utility/state-run enterprise/public foundation or enterprise, often charitable
